%md ## Finding connected components _A **subgraph** is a graph whose vertices are a subset of the vertex set of the original graph and whose edges are a subset of the edge set of the original graph._ _A **connected component** is a subgraph in which any two vertices are connected to each other by an edge or a series of edges._ The connected components algorithm labels each connected component of the graph with the ID of its lowest-numbered vertex. Consider the following data set:

Follower Followee
John Pat
Pat Dave
Gary Chris
Chris Bill

The preceding data is a simple one with six vertices and two clusters. Let's put this data in the form of two lists: _verticesList_ and _edgesList_. The following is the content of _verticesList_: 1,John 2,Pat 3,Dave 4,Gary 5,Chris 6,Bill The following is the content of _edgesList_: 1,2,follows 2,3,follows 4,5,follows 5,6,follows A connected component algorithm is expected to identify two clusters, the first one identified by (1,John) and the second by (4,Gary Exercise: Print the connected component results.
